name: SPARQL KB Connector
info:
Inputs:

ONE QUERY:
 Required: msg.query :
  The Query itself (String or JSON (created from SPARQL.js Parser ONLY!))
 Optional (for query string): msg.mode :
  FORCE 'select' or 'update' (or 'delete') for SPARQL 1.1
  Best in Auto Mode...
 Optional: msg.endpoint : Alternate endpoint

--OR--
MANY QUERIES:
 Required: msg.queries: Array of Query Strings!

Sparql errors are filtered before query is sent to KB.
-------------------------------------------------
FOR EACH ONE QUERY:
Outputs:
 For select: Array of objects
    Each has key value pairs. Key is variable name
 For update: msg.payload[0] is 'Success' or 'Failure'
    msg.payload[1] is the message.
    The rest is up to the server.

FOR MANY QUERIES:
Array of the outputs,
one output at the index of the corresponding query.

More on:
SPARQL.js: https://github.com/RubenVerborgh/SPARQL.js/

name: BranchJoin
info:
The BranchJoin node can be used in each branch that you need to join. One overall Join node should be used in the end, linking all the outputs of the individual BranchJoin nodes.

The UI node needs to be configured with the following details:
 - Total count is the total number of branches expected to join.
 - Position in sequence should be from 1 to total count.

All branch outputs need to produce a relevant message for the final message to be complete and recompiled.
